title: China begins training for their first team of youth volunteers from Guangzhou City who are to be sent to the Seychelles
description: In January 2007, Guangzhou City (Guangdong Province) recruited 10 youth volunteers to go to Seychelles for a year beginning on January 26th. The volunteers include 5 doctors, 2 nurses, 2 music teachers (1 for piano and 1 for violin), and 1 Chinese teacher. The volunteers worked in Victoria National Hospital, Music College and Seychelles Education Department, respectively.   #35286, #35282,#35283,#35284, #35285
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
China begins training for their first team of youth volunteers from Guangzhou City who are to be sent to the Seychelles

# Description
In January 2007, Guangzhou City (Guangdong Province) recruited 10 youth volunteers to go to Seychelles for a year beginning on January 26th. The volunteers include 5 doctors, 2 nurses, 2 music teachers (1 for piano and 1 for violin), and 1 Chinese teacher. The volunteers worked in Victoria National Hospital, Music College and Seychelles Education Department, respectively.   #35286, #35282,#35283,#35284, #35285
justification: Project focuses on youth volunteer program for healthcare and education, with no direct energy or environmental impact
evidence: Volunteers include medical professionals and teachers, working in hospitals and education institutions

title: China donates to Presidential Children's Village in Seychelles
description: On September 14, 2007, the Chinese Embassy, on behalf of then President Hu Jintao's wife, Liu Yongqing, officially donated unspecified items to the Presidential Children's Village in Seychelles, a state-run welfare home for minors.  The value of this donation is unknown.

justification: Project is a social welfare donation with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation to state-run welfare home for minors, unspecified items, social infrastructure focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates 100,000 SCR to Seychelles University Fund
description: On September 17, 2007, the Chinese Embassy in Seychelles officially donated 100,000 SCR to the Seychelles University Fund, which was used to finance the creation of the University of Seychelles. The University of Seychelles officially opened in September 2009 with the first batch of students.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates 100,000 SCR to Seychelles University Fund

# Description
On September 17, 2007, the Chinese Embassy in Seychelles officially donated 100,000 SCR to the Seychelles University Fund, which was used to finance the creation of the University of Seychelles. The University of Seychelles officially opened in September 2009 with the first batch of students.
justification: Project is a financial donation for educational purposes with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation to university fund, education sector focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates office equipment to Seychelles State House
description: In January 2007, the Chinese Embassy in Seychelles donated office equipment to the Seychelles State House. The donated equipment included computers, printers, and other accessors and was expected to facilitate the work of the presidency's staff. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Government provides 14 scholarships to Seychelles students in 2007
description: In August 2007, the Chinese Government officially awarded scholarships to 14 Seychelles recipients to support their studies in China. The value of each scholarship is unknown.

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 115.9 million government concessional loan (GCL) for Sierra Leone CDMA Network Project
description: On December 21, 2006, China Eximbank and Sierra Leone’s Ministry of Finance preferential loan framework agreement with the Government of Sierra Leone’s Ministry of Finance. It specified that China Eximbank would provide a preferential loan for this project and its value would not exceed RMB 133 million.   Then, on April 10, 2007, the China Eximbank and the Government of Sierra Leone signed an RMB 115,984,112 government concessional loan (GCL) loan agreement for the Sierra Leone CDMA Network Project. The GCL carried the following terms: 2 percent interest, 5 year grace period, 20 year maturity, 1% management fee, and 0.75% commitment fee. The proceeds from this loan were, in turn, on-lent to Sierratel, a state-owned fixed line telecommunications operator in Sierra Leone.   The purpose of this project was to purchase Huawei’s fixed-wireless telecommunications equipment and thereby help Sierratel install a 3G (Code Division Multiplex Access, or CDMA) network in the country. The project sought to install 100,000 lines in Freetown and 14 other cities. Huawei was the contractor responsible for implementation. The project commenced on April 24, 2009 and it was completed. However, its precise completion date is unknown.
staff_comments: Chinese project name: 升级塞拉利昂农村电信网项目 or CDMA农村覆盖网络.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 115.9 million government concessional loan (GCL) for Sierra Leone CDMA Network Project

# Description
On December 21, 2006, China Eximbank and Sierra Leone’s Ministry of Finance preferential loan framework agreement with the Government of Sierra Leone’s Ministry of Finance. It specified that China Eximbank would provide a preferential loan for this project and its value would not exceed RMB 133 million.   Then, on April 10, 2007, the China Eximbank and the Government of Sierra Leone signed an RMB 115,984,112 government concessional loan (GCL) loan agreement for the Sierra Leone CDMA Network Project. The GCL carried the following terms: 2 percent interest, 5 year grace period, 20 year maturity, 1% management fee, and 0.75% commitment fee. The proceeds from this loan were, in turn, on-lent to Sierratel, a state-owned fixed line telecommunications operator in Sierra Leone.   The purpose of this project was to purchase Huawei’s fixed-wireless telecommunications equipment and thereby help Sierratel install a 3G (Code Division Multiplex Access, or CDMA) network in the country. The project sought to install 100,000 lines in Freetown and 14 other cities. Huawei was the contractor responsible for implementation. The project commenced on April 24, 2009 and it was completed. However, its precise completion date is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on telecommunications infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Installation of 3G network, purchase of fixed-wireless telecommunications equipment, no direct energy or environmental components

title: Chinese Government cancels RMB 182.2 million of Government of Sierra Leone's outstanding debt obligations
description: According to the Bank of Sierra Leone’s Annual Report and Statement of Accounts for year ended 31 December 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sierra Leone signed a debt exemption agreement on November 6, 2007.  Chinese Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Zhai Jun, and Sierra Leone's Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Zainab Bangura signed the agreement. The monetary value of the outstanding debt obligations that were cancelled was RMB 182,224,600 and they resulted from five interest-free loans that the Government of Sierra Leone previously contracted and that reached maturity on or before December 31, 2005.
staff_comments: This debt forgiveness project is not marked as an umbrella project since the original loans were likely contracted before 2000. The dataset does not capture any interest-free loans prior to 2005, so there is no risk of double counting.
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
Chinese Government cancels RMB 182.2 million of Government of Sierra Leone's outstanding debt obligations

# Description
According to the Bank of Sierra Leone’s Annual Report and Statement of Accounts for year ended 31 December 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sierra Leone signed a debt exemption agreement on November 6, 2007.  Chinese Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Zhai Jun, and Sierra Leone's Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Zainab Bangura signed the agreement. The monetary value of the outstanding debt obligations that were cancelled was RMB 182,224,600 and they resulted from five interest-free loans that the Government of Sierra Leone previously contracted and that reached maturity on or before December 31, 2005.
justification: Debt cancellation is a financial transaction without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Debt exemption agreement, cancellation of outstanding debt obligations

title: Chinese Government dispatches 13th medical team to King Harman Road Hospital
description: China has been sending medical teams to Sierra Leone from Hunan Province since 1973. China stopped sending medical teams in 1993 due to civil conflict and political instability. However, it began sending teams again in 2002. On August 10, 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sierra Leone signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 13th Chinese medical team to Sierra Leone. The 10-member team was stationed at King Harman Road Hospital in the capital city of Freetown.   It completed its term of service between July 2007 and July 2009. The members of the team had expertise in internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, gynecology, ear-nose-throat, ophthalmology, anesthesia, and radiology.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 13th medical team to King Harman Road Hospital

# Description
China has been sending medical teams to Sierra Leone from Hunan Province since 1973. China stopped sending medical teams in 1993 due to civil conflict and political instability. However, it began sending teams again in 2002. On August 10, 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sierra Leone signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 13th Chinese medical team to Sierra Leone. The 10-member team was stationed at King Harman Road Hospital in the capital city of Freetown.   It completed its term of service between July 2007 and July 2009. The members of the team had expertise in internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, gynecology, ear-nose-throat, ophthalmology, anesthesia, and radiology.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment, healthcare expertise in various medical fields, hospital-based services
